p: The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC), which is the lowest concentration of a chemical which prevents the growth of a bacterium, was used for selecting percentage of orange oil loading in the film. In this study, the MICs of orange oil against the growth of S. aureus and P. acnes were at the concentration of 2.5 mg/mL. Therefore, the concentration of orange oil (3%) above MIC was then selected and used for film preparation.
